comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Apparently this is Helena (or Yelena, or Jelena) Lozanich , daughter of Dr. Sima Lozanich, a Serbian diplomat. She married an American, John Whipple Frothingham. In 1914 she was appointed by the Serbian Red Cross to visit North America and raise funds. Her wedding was announced in the New York Times under the name Helen Losanitch, and that seems to be the spelling she used later in life. Here's a book published under her married name, letters she wrote during her travels in the US and Canada, 1915-1920: books.google.com/books/about/Mission_for_Serbia.html?id=f... Her much younger sister Stanka married a Scotsman, Patrick Maitland, the Earl of Lauderdale: www.guardian.co.uk/politics/2008/dec/08/conservatives-lor...
